definition: to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Users can buy refill card at retail and add credit to the pre-paid account.
sentences.chinese: 用户可以购买充值卡，给预付费账号充值。

sentences.english: I will buy a top-up card today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天要买张充值卡了。

sentences.english: When you finished, you can recharge with a prepaid card.
sentences.chinese: 当你用完后，用充值卡充值就可以。

sentences.english: Did you keep the used credit rechargeable card ?
sentences.chinese: 您还留着以前用过的充值卡吗？

sentences.english: You can buy recharge card in Business Center.
sentences.chinese: 您好，商务中心有充值卡出售。

sentences.english: Do you sell fee recharging card?
sentences.chinese: 请问您这里有卖手机充值卡吗？

sentences.english: Can the telecommunication rechargeable prepaid card charge Q currency?

definition: online banking/abbr. for 網上銀行|网上银行[wang3 shang4 yin2 hang2]
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
see 無記名|无记名[wu2 ji4 ming2]
to replace a lost or damaged SIM card, retaining one's original telephone number/SIM replacement
